page.title: 13Beverley Recollections
page.content: Some children from St. Nicholas C.P. school interviewed Mrs. Barnard aged 80 years old. She has lived in this area for many years and previously taught at the school. Her recollections of life and information passed on to her from colleagues was fascinating. For instance the three largest sources of employment are no longer available.They were the glue works,the barges and the shipyard. Work at the glue works was hard and dirty,and it was a glue process which caused the obnoxious smell which pervaded the air. Mrs. Barnard recalled that during her teaching career there were many occasions when the stench was so appalling that the headteacher was obliged to ask the factory manager to close the doors in an effort to curb the smell.
